fields.help_text: Appears on the home page left had block.

fields.body: We bring together publishers, publishing service providers, and scholarly libraries to secure the diversity and financial futures of open access book production and dissemination.
fields.help_text: Displays below the main header on the home page.
Header section, first column, title.
Index section, column two, header
Index section, column three, header
Index section, column four, header

fields.body: Creating a space for publishers, service providers, libraries and others to learn, network and support each another.
fields.help_text: Index section, column one, body

fields.body: Delivering new, more reliable revenue streams to small to medium-sized publishers, helping them move away from relying on book processing charges.
fields.help_text: Index section, column two, body

fields.body: Delivering new financial resources to the vital infrastructures of OA book publishing and making it easier to integrate OA books into library catalogues.
fields.help_text: Index section, column three, body

fields.body: Supporting a variety of approaches to OA publishing, while making OA for books more accessible to a wider range of authors and institutions.
fields.help_text: Index section, column four, body

fields.body: If you wish to go ahead with this quote you can click the "Proceed" button below. We will collect some information and generate your order.

Appears on the view basket page.

fields.body:
To proceed with this quote, we now need to gather information to allow us to provide prices relevant to your institution’s banding type. To continue, please complete the form below, or contact OBC staff at info@openbookcollective.org who will be happy to generate a quote on your behalf.

Some bandings refer to ‘high’, ‘middle’ and ‘low’ income countries, as defined by the World Bank. You can find the latest Country Classifications by Income here.
fields.help_text: Appears when a user is not logged in and tries to get a price for a basket.
Header for the order form page.
Subheader for the order form page.
Packages header on the order form page

fields.body: The following packages are in your order:
fields.help_text: Appears on the order form page.
Appears on the order form page.

fields.body: Complete the form below so that we can begin processing your order.
fields.help_text: Instructions for completing the order form.

fields.body:
Provider Contract(s): For Review

If you would like to go ahead and support your chosen initiatives via the Open Book Collective, there are two sets of documents for you to review. The first includes the Provider contracts for the Membership Offers you have provisionally chosen to support. These detail the commitments that Providers have made to us, the Open Book Collective, and to all Supporting Institutions. We’ve created a zipped up document for all of the packages you have expressed an interest in supporting.
fields.help_text: First chunk of the order page.

fields.body:
Terms and Conditions: For Review

You should also review the commitments that we, the Open Book Collective, make to you, as a Supporting Institution. You can review our Supporter Terms and Conditions.

If you would like to proceed after having reviewed both the Provider Contracts and our Terms and Conditions, you can go ahead and ‘Approve’ below.

Open Book Collective Contact Details

If you would like to discuss any details of your quotation with us, you can contact us at info@openbookcollective.org

Provider Contact Details

If you would like to discuss any details of the Membership Offers you have added to your quotation with a Provider, you can contact them using the contact details below.
fields.help_text: Second chunk of the order screen text.

fields.body:
Approval

As detailed in our Funding and Fees page, we add a 5% Supporter Contribution charge to the amounts charged by Providers to Supporters. While the Open Book Collective operates as a not-for-profit, these contributions help us to cover our operating costs. The Supporter Contribution charge is added at the invoicing stage.

When you are happy with both our terms and conditions and the commitments detailed in the Provider contracts, you can go ahead with your order by marking the quotation as ‘Approved’. You may need to wait for the Provider to approve the signup for the process to be completed.

Once all Approvals have been completed, we will go ahead and issue an invoice on behalf of the selected Providers, as well as for our Supporter Contribution charge.
fields.help_text: Third chunk of order text.
